did.abstract: Collection includes letters from Fox to his publishers, Harper & Brothers, and "The Century." Letters of 1890-1896 are to Richard Watson Gilder and Robert Underwood Johnson of "The Century" and concern the publication of Fox's story, "A Cumberland Vendetta." Letters of 1897 are to Harper & Brothers and concern two of Fox's books, Hell-fer-Sartain and The Kentuckians. A letter of 1901, from Fox to an unidentified person named Ellen, refers to borrowing some of her ideas for his forthcoming book, Bluegrass and Rhododendron.
